case_vignette: A 52-year-old woman with HIV infection is brought to the emergency department 20 minutes after she had a generalized tonic-clonic seizure. She appears lethargic and confused. Laboratory studies show a CD4+ count of 89 cells/μL (N > 500). A CT scan of the head with contrast shows multiple ring-enhancing lesions in the basal ganglia and subcortical white matter. An India ink preparation of cerebrospinal fluid is negative.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I recently had a seizure where my whole body shook uncontrollably, and now I'm feeling really sluggish and confused.
Have you had any other seizures before?
No, this was my first seizure.
Have you been taking any medications for any medical conditions?
Yes, I've been taking medications for my HIV infection.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication regimen?
I don't recall any recent changes in my medication.
Have you had any recent changes in your lifestyle or routine?
No, nothing has changed in my lifestyle or routine recently.
Have you had any recent head injuries or trauma?
No, I haven't had any head injuries or trauma recently.
Have you had any recent stressful events or changes in your life?
No, there haven't been any stressful events or big changes in my life lately.
Have you had any family history of seizures or neurological disorders?
I'm sorry, but I don't have any information regarding family history of seizures or neurological disorders.
Final Diagnosis: HIV-associated neurocognitive disorder (HAND)
